Getting started

Source: vignettes/pharmOncoX.Rmd
pharmOncoX.Rmd



Installation 


if (!("remotes" %in% installed.packages()) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}
remotes::install_github('sigven/pharmOncoX')



Retrieval of drugs - examples

Get BRAF-targeted drugs, list records per indication 

library(pharmOncoX)

## load the data
cache_dir <- tempdir()

drugs <- get_drugs(
  cache_dir = cache_dir,
  drug_is_targeted = T,
    drug_target = c('BRAF'))
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:16] Downloading remote dataset from Google Drive to cache_dir
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:18] Reading from cache_dir = ' (/tmp/RtmpvilFeM'), argument force_download = F

## Number of drug records
nrow(drugs$records)
#> [1] 237

Get BRAF-targeted drugs, Open Targets Platform only, list per drug only 


drugs <- get_drugs(
  cache_dir = cache_dir, 
  drug_is_targeted = T,
    drug_target = c('BRAF'), 
  source_opentargets_only = T, 
  output_resolution = "drug" )

drugs$records <- 
  dplyr::select(
    drugs$records,
    -c("drug_alias",
       "disease_main_group",
       "drug_clinical_id")) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    disease_indication = stringr::str_replace_all(
      disease_indication, "\\|",", ")
    )

dt_drugtable1 <- DT::datatable(
  drugs$records,
  escape = FALSE,
  extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"), 
  width = "100%",
  options = list(
    buttons = c("csv", "excel"), 
    dom = "Bfrtip")
)




Get immune checkpoint inhibitors, list per drug-target entry 


drugs <- get_drugs(
  cache_dir = cache_dir, 
  is_immune_checkpoint_inhibitor = T,
   output_resolution = "drug2target")

drugs$records <- 
  dplyr::select(
    drugs$records,
    -c("drug_alias",
       "disease_main_group",
       "drug_clinical_id")) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    disease_indication = stringr::str_replace_all(
      disease_indication, "\\|",", ")
    ) |>
  dplyr::select(
    drug_id,
    drug_name,
    drug_type,
    target_symbol,
    target_genename,
    dplyr::everything()
  )

dt_drugtable2 <- DT::datatable(
  drugs$records,
  escape = FALSE,
  extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"), 
  width = "100%",
  options = list(
    buttons = c("csv", "excel"), 
    dom = "Bfrtip")
)




Get immune checkpoint inhibitors indicated for tumor subtypes within “Colon/Rectum”, list per drug-target entry 


drugs <- get_drugs(
  cache_dir = cache_dir, 
  is_immune_checkpoint_inhibitor = T,
  output_resolution = "drug2target", 
  drug_indication_main = "Colon/Rectum")

drugs$records <- 
  dplyr::select(
    drugs$records,
    -c("drug_alias",
       "disease_main_group",
       "drug_clinical_id")) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    disease_indication = stringr::str_replace_all(
      disease_indication, "\\|",", ")
    ) |>
  dplyr::select(
    drug_id,
    drug_name,
    drug_type,
    target_symbol,
    target_genename,
    dplyr::everything()
  )

dt_drugtable3 <- DT::datatable(
  drugs$records,
  escape = FALSE,
  extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"), 
  width = "100%",
  options = list(
    buttons = c("csv", "excel"), 
    dom = "Bfrtip")
)




Get antimetabolite drugs 


drugs <- get_drugs(
  cache_dir = cache_dir, 
  is_antimetabolite = T,
  output_resolution = "drug")
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpvilFeM', argument force_download = F
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Object 'drug_map_name' sucessfully loaded
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Retrieved n = 7653 records
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpvilFeM', argument force_download = F
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Object 'drug_map_alias' sucessfully loaded
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Retrieved n = 187616 records
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpvilFeM', argument force_download = F
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Object 'drug_map_basic' sucessfully loaded
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Retrieved n = 7654 records
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpvilFeM', argument force_download = F
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Object 'drug_map_target' sucessfully loaded
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Retrieved n = 11822 records
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpvilFeM', argument force_download = F
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Object 'drug_map_indication' sucessfully loaded
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:36] Retrieved n = 28407 records
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:37] Record set satisfying user-defined criteria: n = 4572
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:37] Collapsing record set - providing output on a 'per_drug' resolution
#> INFO  [2023-01-12 13:25:37] Final record set: n = 73 records

drugs$records <- 
  dplyr::select(
    drugs$records,
    -c("drug_alias",
       "disease_main_group",
       "drug_clinical_id")) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    disease_indication = stringr::str_replace_all(
      disease_indication, "\\|",", ")
    )

dt_drugtable4 <- DT::datatable(
  drugs$records,
  escape = FALSE,
  extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"), 
  width = "100%",
  options = list(
    buttons = c("csv", "excel"), 
    dom = "Bfrtip")
)

References

Freshour, Sharon L, Susanna Kiwala, Kelsy C Cotto, Adam C Coffman, Joshua F McMichael, Jonathan J Song, Malachi Griffith, Obi L Griffith, and Alex H Wagner. 2021. “Integration of the Drug-Gene Interaction Database (DGIdb 4.0) with Open Crowdsource Efforts.” Nucleic Acids Res. 49 (D1): D1144–51. http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa1084.
Kim, Sunghwan, Jie Chen, Tiejun Cheng, Asta Gindulyte, Jia He, Siqian He, Qingliang Li, et al. 2021. “PubChem in 2021: New Data Content and Improved Web Interfaces.” Nucleic Acids Res. 49 (D1): D1388–95. http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa971.
Nakken, Sigve. 2022. phenOncoX: A Phenotype Ontology Map for Cancer. https://github.com/sigven/phenOncoX.
Ochoa, David, Andrew Hercules, Miguel Carmona, Daniel Suveges, Asier Gonzalez-Uriarte, Cinzia Malangone, Alfredo Miranda, et al. 2021. “Open Targets Platform: Supporting Systematic Drug-Target Identification and Prioritisation.” Nucleic Acids Res. 49 (D1): D1302–10. http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa1027.
Sioutos, Nicholas, Sherri de Coronado, Margaret W Haber, Frank W Hartel, Wen-Ling Shaiu, and Lawrence W Wright. 2007. “NCI Thesaurus: A Semantic Model Integrating Cancer-Related Clinical and Molecular Information.” J. Biomed. Inform. 40 (1): 30–43. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jbi.2006.02.013.
